com.googlecode.rockit.conn.ilpSolver

Class GurobiConnector

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.googlecode.rockit.conn.ilpSolver.GurobiConnector

  • public class GurobiConnector
extends Object
    Represents the connector to the Gurobi solver. This class is a singleton class.
    Author:
    jan

      • addObjectiveVariable

        public void addObjectiveVariable(String varName)
                          throws ILPException
        Adds a binary variable with weight 0 into the Gurobi API. GRBVar addVar ( double lb, double ub, double obj, char type, String name ) Before adding, it checks if the variable already exists. If it does, it will NOT be added.
        Parameters:
        varName -
        Throws:
        ILPException

      • removeAndAddGlobalCardinalityConstraint

        public void removeAndAddGlobalCardinalityConstraint(int cardinality)
                                             throws ILPException
        The Gurobi Connector is able to maintain one global cardinality function. This global cardinality function can be modified (removed and the new one is added). This functionality is needed for the ExactKBoundedMapInference algorithm. Here, all variables xi with a value greater than 0 are added to the cardinality function. Builds cardinality restrictions of the form: x1 + x2 + ... + xN <= cardinality and adds it to the ILP.
        Parameters:
        cardinality -
        Throws:
        ILPException

      • addHardConstraint

        public void addHardConstraint(ArrayList<Literal> axioms)
                       throws SolveException
        Adds binary restriction in which every variable has to be true. It builds restrictions like (1-x1) + (1-x2) + x3 + x4 + x5 <= 1 Thus, x1 and x2 must be negative in the ilp while x3,x4 and x5 must be positive (+0) in the ilp. If we have just one axiom in the list, the evidence is directly encoded by restricting the variable to - lb = 0 and ub = 0 (negated) or - lb = 1 and ub = 1 (positive).
        Parameters:
        axioms - Array of components (including name and positive and negated information)
        Throws:
        ParseException - When adding a restriction, there has to be as many variable names as entries in the hasToBePositive Array.
        SolveException

      • addSingleSoftConstraint

        public void addSingleSoftConstraint(double weight,
                           ArrayList<Literal> restriction,
                           boolean conjunction)
                             throws SolveException
        Adds binary restrictions for soft constraints.
        Parameters:
        weight - value of the target function weight of the soft formular
        variableNames - names of the variables
        mustBePositive - Array with values if the respective variable (same position in array) has to be positive or negative
        conjunction - if true, the whole formula is added as conjunction, if false it is added as disjunction.
        dublicateDetection - this string detects if a similar formula has already been added. If no, the formula is added. If yes, the weight of the formula is increased (but no new z variable is generated).
        Throws:
        ParseException - When adding a restriction, there has to be as many variable names as entries in the hasToBePositive Array.
        SolveException

      • getOneFixedVariableOfIIS

        public String getOneFixedVariableOfIIS()
                                throws SolveException
        Calculates the Irreducible Inconsistent Subsystem. An IIS is a subset of the constraints and variable bounds of the original model. If all constraints in the model except those in the IIS are removed, the model is still infeasible. However, further removing any one member of the IIS produces a feasible result. After IIS calculation it returns the variable name as String. If nothing is found (which should not be possible), the method throws an exception.
        Parameters:
        filename -
        Throws:
        SolveException

      • fixObjectiveVariable

        public void fixObjectiveVariable(String variableName,
                        boolean fixToTrue,
                        boolean fixToFalse)
                          throws SolveException
        Fixes a objective variable either to true (>=1) or false (<=0). if fixToTrue AND fixToFalse is false, then the variable is "free" again; it can be 0 or 1. if both are true, an exception is thrown. If the variable is not yet in the ILP, then it is added to target function with weight 0.0.
        Parameters:
        variableName -
        fixToTrue - if true, then its fixed to true
        fixToFalse - if true, then its fixed to false
        Throws:
        SolveException - if both are true, an exception is thrown.

        public HashMap<String,Integer> optimizeILP()

        Returns:
        solution.
        Throws:
        ILPException - thrown if infeasible.

        Returns:

      • getVariables

        public HashMap<String,Double> getVariables()
                                    throws ILPException
        Returns all the variables available in the current ILP including the "zzz" variables. The double value contains the actual weight of the variable in the target function.
        Returns:
        Throws:
        ILPException
